1: Fools say to themselves,[b] “There is no God.”[c] They sin and commit evil deeds;[d] none of them does what is right.[e]
2: The Lord looks down from heaven[f] at the human race,[g] to see if there is anyone who is wise[h] and seeks God.[i]
3: Everyone rejects God;[j] they are all morally corrupt.[k] None of them does what is right,[l] not even one.
4: All those who behave wickedly[m] do not understand—[n] those who devour my people as if they were eating bread, and do not call out to the Lord.
5: They are absolutely terrified,[o] for God defends the godly.[p]
6: You want to humiliate the oppressed,[q] even though[r] the Lord is their[s] shelter.
7: I wish the deliverance[t] of Israel would come from Zion! When the Lord restores the well-being of his people,[u] may Jacob rejoice,[v] may Israel be happy![w]
